p: We aim to fulfil the accuracy and resolution requirements needed for local forest management. Consequently, our study area is restricted to the Spanish Iberian Peninsula, for which there are specific sources of information such as data from the Spanish Meteorological Agency (AEMET) and from the Spanish National Forest Inventory. A solid and high resolution assessment of abiotic and biotic exposure of P. pinaster can assist managers in selecting among the distinct available practices in order to enhance this economically important pine to cope with the aforementioned stresses: breeding programs, particular silvicultural methods [ 43] and/or different monitoring schemes.
